text: There is Dive Into Python which leads you by example.
Also, if you prefer Head first series, there is Head First Python available too.
There are tons of (free) resources for learning Python.
The Python docs provides a tutorial.
You may want to try this: http://learnpythonthehardway.org/static/LearnPythonTheHardWay.pdf
Learning a new language is often like writing...you just need to start typing
If you have 0 programming background, Non-Programmer's Tutorial for Python is very good.
I really like ""Core Python Programming" by Wesley Chun.
Check out Python by Example (a web page).
You can also start on trypython.org, a website.
It starts from the basics and might be what you are looking for.

try http://www.zacharski.org/books/python-for-linguists/
it's focusing on analysing texts but the examples are really clear
